entries.content: You have to be able to make them think differently because if they don't think differently then why would I give you a load of money or my time?
entries.notes: Framing value by challenging the prospect's current thinking.

entries.content: If you're the same as the other five or six or seven or ten or dozen sales guys that have gone in before, you're not resonating, you're not standing out.
entries.notes: Highlighting the importance of differentiation beyond standard pitches.

entries.content: Challenge the status quo of what's happening in this business.
entries.notes: A method for unearthing pain points and positioning oneself uniquely.

entries.content: If you want to be treated differently then you have to act differently.
entries.notes: Differentiating your approach to avoid being judged solely on price or likability.

entries.content: Stop acting like a sycophant and stop trying to suck up. Go on there and say, 'Hey look, if you've got a problem I can fix, then you better let me do my job.'
entries.notes: Adopting a confident, value-focused posture that differentiates from subservient competitors.

entries.content: Selling not telling: Focus on understanding the customer's challenges, unearthing their pain points, rather than just presenting information.
entries.notes: A method to differentiate by focusing on discovery and the customer's specific needs.

focus_area: Competitive Objections: Unique value framing without attacking others
